publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2289 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde Schools Win Place in Prestigious Choir of the Year Competition—That the Parliament congratulates a talented group of around 60 youngsters from schools across Inverclyde who have reached the finals of the prestigious BBC Radio 3 Choir of the Year competition; notes that it will be the only Scottish choir in the children’s category final, which takes place on 8 and 9 November 2008 at the Philharmonic Hall in Liverpool; acknowledges the hard work that the pupils have put into achieving the goal of reaching the final, and wishes them every success. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Nanette Milne*, Bill Wilson*
S3M-2289 Inverclyde Schools Win Place in Prestigious Choir of the Year Competition (lodged on 27 June 2008) Angela Constance*, Alasdair Allan*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-2289 Inverclyde Schools Win Place in Prestigious Choir of the Year Competition (lodged on 27 June 2008) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-2289 Inverclyde Schools Win Place in Prestigious Choir of the Year Competition (lodged on 27 June 2008) Annabel Goldie*
